Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=6.25 µM), Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=25 µM), Enterobacter cloacae (MIC=6.25 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=25 µM);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=6.25 µM), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=6.25 µM), Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=12.5 µM).Yeast:Candida albicans (MIC=100 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: Kassinatuerin-1 a peptide with broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity isolated from the skin of the hyperoliid frog, Kassina senegalensis.
Literature.Author: Mattute B, Knoop FC, Conlon JM.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial and cytolytic properties of the frog skin peptide, kassinatuerin-1 and its L- and D-lysine-substituted derivatives.
